Uses of Package
com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations

  • Packages that use com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations 
    Package Description
    com.aeonium.javafx.validation
    This package provides deklarative validation for JavaFX user interfaces with the following goals: A simple way of declaring validation constraints on a input field, an (at best) unobtrusive way of wiring submit controls to the validation.
  • Classes in com.aeonium.javafx.validation.annotations used by com.aeonium.javafx.validation 
    Class and Description
    FXNotNull
    Marks a selection control, e.g.
    FXNumber
    Marks a text input field as numeric input.
    FXRequired
    Mark a text-input field as required, i.e., it must have a non-empty input string.
    FXString
    Define constraints for a string input field, e.g., minimum length and/or maximum length.
    FXValidationChecked
    This annotation marks a control or BooleanProperty that's enabled state is bound to the validation results of the validation constraints in the same scene.
